t: Matthew 15
Tradition and Commandment
Then*p some Pharisees and scribes came to Jesus from Jerusalem and said,
“Why do Your disciples break the tradition of the elders? For they do not wash their hands when they eat bread.”
And He answered and said to them, “Why*r do*r you*r yourselves*r transgress*r the*r commandment*r of*r God*r for*r the*r sake*r of*r your*r tradition?*r
For*r God*r said,*r ‘Honor*sr your*sr father*sr and*sr mother,’*sr and,*r ‘He*sr who*sr speaks*sr evil*sr of*sr father*sr or*sr mother*sr is*sr to*sr be*sr put*sr to*sr death.’*sr
But*r you*r say,*r ‘Whoever*r says*r to*r his*ir father*r or*r mother,*r “Whatever*r I*r have*r that*r would*r help*r you*r has*r been*r given*r to*ir God,”*ir
he*r is*r not*r to*r honor*r his*r father*r or*r his*r mother.’*r And*r by*ir this*ir you*r invalidated*r the*r word*r of*r God*r for*r the*r sake*r of*r your*r tradition.*r
You*r hypocrites,*r rightly*r did*r Isaiah*r prophesy*r of*r you:*r
‘This*srpn people*sr honors*sr Me*sr with*sr their*sr lips,*sr But*srln their*sr heart*sr is*sr far*sr away*sr from*sr Me.*sr
But*srln in*sr vain*sr do*sr they*sr worship*sr Me,*sr Teaching*srln as*sr doctrines*sr the*sr precepts*sr of*sr men*sr .’ ”*r
After*p Jesus called the crowd to Him, He said to them, “Hear*r and*r understand.*r
It*ir is*ir not*r what*r enters*r into*r the*r mouth*r that*ir defiles*r the*r man,*r but*r what*r proceeds*r out*r of*r the*r mouth,*r this*r defiles*r the*r man.”*r
Then*p the disciples came and said to Him, “Do You know that the Pharisees were offended when they heard this statement?”
But He answered and said, “Every*r plant*r which*r My*r heavenly*r Father*r did*r not*r plant*r shall*r be*r uprooted.*r
Let*r them*r alone;*r they*r are*r blind*r guides*r of*r the*r blind.*r And*r if*r a*r blind*r man*r guides*r a*r blind*r man,*r both*r will*r fall*r into*r a*r pit.”*r
The Heart of Man
Peter*p said to Him, “Explain the parable to us.”
Jesus said, “Are*r you*r still*r lacking*r in*r understanding*r also?*r
Do*r you*r not*r understand*r that*r everything*r that*r goes*r into*r the*r mouth*r passes*r into*r the*r stomach,*r and*r is*r eliminated?*r
But*r the*r things*r that*r proceed*r out*r of*r the*r mouth*r come*r from*r the*r heart,*r and*r those*r defile*r the*r man.*r
For*r out*r of*r the*r heart*r come*r evil*r thoughts,*r murders,*r adulteries,*r fornications,*r thefts,*r false*r witness,*r slanders.*r
These*r are*r the*r things*r which*r defile*r the*r man;*r but*r to*r eat*r with*r unwashed*r hands*r does*r not*r defile*r the*r man.”*r
The Syrophoenician Woman
Jesus*p went away from there, and withdrew into the district of Tyre and Sidon.
And a Canaanite woman from that region came out and began*i to cry out, saying, “Have mercy on me, Lord, Son of David; my daughter is cruelly demon-possessed.”
But He did not answer her a word. And His disciples came and implored Him, saying, “Send her away, because she keeps shouting at us.”
But He answered and said, “I*r was*r sent*r only*r to*r the*r lost*r sheep*r of*r the*r house*r of*r Israel.”*r
But she came and began*i to bow down before Him, saying, “Lord, help me!”
And He answered and said, “It*r is*r not*r good*r to*r take*r the*r children’s*r bread*r and*r throw*r it*r to*r the*r dogs.”*r
But she said, “Yes, Lord; but even the dogs feed on the crumbs which fall from their masters’ table.”
Then Jesus said to her, “O*r woman,*r your*r faith*r is*r great;*r it*r shall*r be*r done*r for*r you*r as*r you*r wish.”*r And her daughter was healed at once.
Healing Crowds
Departing*p from there, Jesus went along by the Sea of Galilee, and having gone up on the mountain, He was sitting there.
And large crowds came to Him, bringing with them those*i who*i were*i lame, crippled, blind, mute, and many others, and they laid them down at His feet; and He healed them.
So the crowd marveled as they saw the mute speaking, the crippled restored, and the lame walking, and the blind seeing; and they glorified the God of Israel.
Four Thousand Fed

And*p Jesus called His disciples to Him, and said, “I*r feel*r compassion*r for*r the*r people,*r because*r they*r have*r remained*r with*r Me*r now*r three*r days*r and*r have*r nothing*r to*r eat;*r and*r I*r do*r not*r want*r to*r send*r them*r away*r hungry,*r for*r they*r might*r faint*r on*r the*r way.”*r
The disciples said to Him, “Where would we get so many loaves in this*i desolate place to satisfy such a large crowd?”
And Jesus said to them, “How*r many*r loaves*r do*r you*r have?”*r And they said, “Seven, and a few small fish.”
And He directed the people to sit down on the ground;
and He took the seven loaves and the fish; and giving thanks, He broke them and started giving them to the disciples, and the disciples gave*i them*i to the people.
And they all ate and were satisfied, and they picked up what was left over of the broken pieces, seven large baskets full.
And those who ate were four thousand men, besides women and children.
And*p sending away the crowds, Jesus got into the boat and came to the region of Magadan.
